meanings.definition: To communicate or send a message using a radio.
meanings.sent1: She radioed for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The police radioed the description of the suspect to all units.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut radioed to mission control about the successful launch.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory radioed through the town like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: His urgent call radioed across the airwaves, reaching those in need of assistance.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she radioed the coordinates to the rescue team.
meanings.sent2: He radioed the all-clear signal after the storm had passed.
meanings.sent3: The captain radioed the final instructions before the mission began.
meanings.sent4: The message was radioed just in time to prevent a disaster.
meanings.sent5: Having radioed the message, he waited anxiously for a response.

meanings.definition: Having been communicated or sent using a radio.
meanings.sent1: The radioed message was received clearly by the team.
meanings.sent2: The radioed transmission contained vital information for the operation.
meanings.sent3: The radioed signal was so strong, it reached far beyond the expected range.
meanings.sent4: The radioed announcement echoed through the valley, surprising all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The radioed news spread rapidly, causing excitement among the listeners.
